channel.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
channel.description:
For lack of a better place to put this right now, we see the third arrival of a RuneScape Grandmaster quest. Worth it? I'd like to think not.
If you head over to the wikia, you can see the requirements of the quest are phenomenal. You need 80 magic, the highest requisite of any quest to date, among other level 70 requirements. You end up going through some seemingly challenging logic puzzles (easily remedied by a decent quest guide), and fighting a "monstrous" level 599. Comparable to Nomad? Not in a lifetime.
Don't get me wrong, the queen seems pretty tough. She likes using all forms of combat, fights among elite pest control defilers, and has a special attack that hits 500 (but this can be blocked using a special from a weapon you get in the quest). Based on a video I watched, the queen seems to have lifepoints similar to Nomad, which would explain the high level. I would even argue she may have more lifepoints than Nomad, but this is to be determined.
As for the rewards, not so good if you ask me. You get about 120k experience spread over six skills, then two sets of 50k additional experience for any combat levels over 75. You get an elite Void torso, which is an "upgraded" version of the regular torso (which is, to say, it adds a decent +4 prayer bonus). You get a lousy one quest point, and Korasi's sword, which is used against the queen.
In fact, out of all the awards, the only remotely decent one [i]is[/i] Korasi's sword. This new weapon replaces the leaf-bladed sword as the highest stab attack weapon in the game, outside of Daemonheim. It has slightly better accuracy than the leaf-bladed sword (+8 slash, -7 in stab), but has a whopping +20 difference in strength. Korasi's sword actually surpasses the dragon scimitar in strength by +4. It is weaker than the abyssal whip by 12. Nevertheless, it has the same speed as all three.
Some quick opinions about the quest seem to be along the lines of a disappointment that no new boss monster was added and it being considered grandmaster. Otherwise, I think the sword is the only reason worth doing the quest in the first place, and quite a good reason at that. :)
Comments.

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:37, topic:363167”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=459432.msg3363589#msg3363589 date=1286594895]
What a long review. If only there were more huge updates for F2P low-leveled players. Also, Taharok, you have so many long posts.
[/quote]

I might be doing RS update review articles for the front page. This was kinda a preview, seeing if it’s a good idea or not. What do you think?[/quote]
Well then that’d be the first (I’m assuming you’re talking about http://moparisthebest.com) update in a year! In that case, I doubt that people even visit the homepage.

I feel that articles must be divided into separate parts etc. Images or videos are a must or the article will just be plain, ol’, boring text. Just try to make the article, um… more interesting.

Read full topic

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @chargerz chargerz
item.description:
@chargerz wrote:

Thanks to this stupid quest, I have another “grand master” quest to do along with a bunch of small quests…

I mean I have 286 quest points…I could have the damn cape if JaGeX stopped.

I’ll do it after I get 99 hp. (2 levels away)

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:33, topic:363167”][quote author=i have an ax link=topic=459432.msg3363226#msg3363226 date=1286576371]
No. Otherwise you’d have lots more people using CR/CLS there.
[/quote]

Quote from the RS Wiki:

[quote]Stab weapons1.Zamorakian spear**
2.Korasi’s sword*
3.Dragon halberd
4.Dragon longsword*
5.Dragon spear**
6.Vesta’s longsword#*
7.Vesta’s spear#
8.Leaf-bladed sword*
9.Staff of light*
10.Guthan’s warspear

  • = Can be used with a shield slot, such as a Rune defender, further increasing stats.

** = Has a stunning special attack, which can be useful when killing the dark core.

= Hard to obtain/expensive

Note: Statius’s warhammer can be used for its special attack, which lowers the Corporeal Beast’s Defence.

Note: Korasi’s sword with a Rune defender is the optimum offensive setup.

The Corporeal Beast can only be attacked normally by stab attack style, or magic. Range, crush, and slash attacks suffer a 50% damage reduction.

In addition, chaotic weapons from Dungeoneering suffer a 50% damage reduction, even if it is a stab attack style.[/quote]

Read the last sentence.[/quote]
Ah. I read somewhere else that Jagex confirmed all non-spear damage was halved.

Read full topic

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

I just finished the quest - Imo it was decent, the boss was a lot easier than Nomad, and it definitely wasn’t a Grandmaster. The sword is pretty useful though.

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:29, topic:363167”][quote author=i have an ax link=topic=459432.msg3363105#msg3363105 date=1286569272]

Of course, leading onto making the Zamorakian Spear worthless…unless only spears and halberds work on corp for full damage? I’m not really sure how the 50% damage and everything works on corp, as I have only used a Zamorakian Spear or Ruby Bolts (e) to kill it.

I honestly hope that the sword is not effective on corp. I would hate to see people using cheaper gear than they already do there, and the last thing Jagex needs to do is make another God Wars item worthless.

All non-spear damage is halved against CB.
[/quote]

I thought it was all non-stab based attacks are halved. [/quote]

No. Otherwise you’d have lots more people using CR/CLS there.

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Taharok:

I thought it was all non-stab based attacks are halved.

This is what I thought as well, but I have heard that the darklight won’t hit over a certain amount even with the ‘stab’ option selected, but I saw a debate on the RS forums and they were arguing over the exact same thing. I never got an answer though. But like I said, I really hope the new sword cannot be used effectively against corp.

item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:26, topic:363167"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=459432.msg3363049#msg3363049 date=1286565915]

A new skill that isn’t a piece of crap. Their last two have just been awful.

Just wondering, how come you dislike Summoning?

It’s a shit skill.
[/quote]But useful, unlike dungeoneering

True, dungeoneering is more of an activity than a skill.[/quote]
Minigame with levels.

Anyways, is the quest really worth training for and doing? For the requirements, construction and summoning seem to be the only two that I’m not close to meeting, and they both would be worth leveling up.

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Lin:

There are a LOT of great suggestions on their suggestion forum, and I haven’t seen one of them even come close to being put into play.

I have seen a few come into play, but most of them are bug fixes and small updates. Even those small updates require a month or so of bumping the topic and constant posting to make it recognized.

Read full topic

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:15, topic:363167”]It sounds like a pretty simple quest. I wouldn’t classify it as a grandmaster quest.

Well, besides the fact that Jagex is being stupid and putting out quests not many people would be able to do and pushing adding good content away, the quest sounds lame. Once again it seems like all you’re doing is killing a monster, and the money you’re spending on food and everything else is probably enough to get the same exp you could get otherwise.

What “content” would you want them to add other than quests…?[/quote]A new skill that isn’t a piece of crap. Their last two have just been awful. There are a LOT of great suggestions on their suggestion forum, and I haven’t seen one of them even come close to being put into play.

Read full topic

@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:363167”][quote author=Mr Mopar link=topic=459432.msg3362186#msg3362186 date=1286485855]
I finished the quest after about 2 hours after it was released and I thought it was alright and easy.
The sword that you get is better than a dragon scimitar and you also get 2 books which gave 50k exp each.
Along with that, you get an elite void torso.
[ig]http://img215.imageshack.us/img215/5595/woot5.png[/img]
All in all, I think this quest is worth it.
[/quote]Can you show equip pics of sword/torso?[/quote]



My max hit with the special attack

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“i have an ax, post:16, topic:363167”][quote author=Lin link=topic=459432.msg3362241#msg3362241 date=1286489194]
Well, besides the fact that Jagex is being stupid and putting out quests not many people would be able to do and pushing adding good content away, the quest sounds lame. Once again it seems like all you’re doing is killing a monster, and the money you’re spending on food and everything else is probably enough to get the same exp you could get otherwise.
[/quote]
Still, if you’re bored of training a skill, it’s nice to have another option of gaining xp in that skill.[/quote]

I agree. There’s also the fight itself. I heard the fight was fun, etc. I had fun fighting Nomad, and it probably would be a good fight against the queen.

Read full topic

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

Lin:

Well, besides the fact that Jagex is being stupid and putting out quests not many people would be able to do and pushing adding good content away, the quest sounds lame. Once again it seems like all you’re doing is killing a monster, and the money you’re spending on food and everything else is probably enough to get the same exp you could get otherwise.

Still, if you’re bored of training a skill, it’s nice to have another option of gaining xp in that skill.

Read full topic

item.title: Third grandmaster quest -- a review
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

It sounds like a pretty simple quest. I wouldn’t classify it as a grandmaster quest.

Lin:

Well, besides the fact that Jagex is being stupid and putting out quests not many people would be able to do and pushing adding good content away, the quest sounds lame. Once again it seems like all you’re doing is killing a monster, and the money you’re spending on food and everything else is probably enough to get the same exp you could get otherwise.

What “content” would you want them to add other than quests…?

Read full topic
